title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points, shooting 13-for-19, as they defeated the 76ers 109-108.
The Celtics improved to .500 this season and are 1-0 in the NBA Cup’s Group B play after their win.
The Celtics and 76ers both recorded 56 rebounds, with Boston grabbing 16 offensive boards to Philadelphia’s 9.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox faced criticism for wearing a bloodied Jackie Kennedy Halloween costume, calling it a statement on history.
Jack Schlossberg, Kennedy's grandson, criticized Fox's costume as 'disgusting, desperate, and dangerous' on social media.
Fox explained her costume was meant to symbolize Jackie Kennedy's resilience and protest after JFK's assassination.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons' QB Michael Penix Jr. (knee) and WR Drake London (hip) will play against the Patriots in Week 9.
Drake London has 38 receptions on 63 targets with an average of 78.2 yards per game through six games.
Patriots CB Christian Gonzalez, notable for not allowing a touchdown in 478 snaps, will face London's challenge.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow feels the Red Sox are better positioned to acquire key players this offseason after 2025 playoff appearance.
The team faces challenges as Alex Bregman may opt out, creating a gap at third base, and pitcher and shortstop contracts are uncertain.
Despite challenges, Boston has strong financial resources and a top-rated farm system to address roster needs and strengthen the team.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel implemented changes to the Patriots' pregame introductions, replacing a 24-year-old tradition with individual introductions.
The team has moved away from traditional chants and slogans, including the iconic 'Do your job' from Bill Belichick's era.
Vrabel insists changes aim to improve performance, not separate from past as Patriots stand at 6-2 in the AFC East.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained during a recent game.
Marat Khusnutdinov is promoted to top-line center for the Bruins, replacing injured Elias Lindholm.
Lindholm scored four power-play goals this season, contributing significantly to Boston's 13th-ranked power play unit.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Salem, Massachusetts saw a large influx of tourists in costumes on Halloween, the city's busiest day.
Visitors enjoyed street performances, marketplaces, and decorated spots like Rockafellas and Salem Witch Museum.
Tourists engaged in activities like posing for photos, trick-or-treating, and attending a Witches’ Circle on Salem Common.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused Trump of abusing girls with Epstein without providing evidence during a TV interview.
Moulton, challenging Sen. Ed Markey in 2026, called Trump corrupt and linked him to Epstein's activities.
MSNBC host Joe Scarborough confronted Moulton on the lack of evidence for his accusations against Trump.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's next court appearance is scheduled for Nov. 14, with jury selection starting on Nov. 18.
Judge Diane Freniere ordered cell phone evidence from Michael Proctor's investigation to be preserved for Walshe's case.
Walshe's defense attorney argues that undisclosed documents might contain exculpatory evidence, affecting the ongoing trial.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopened after being closed for three days due to asbestos concerns.
The Newton Health Department initially closed the store after the MassDEP reported potential asbestos exposure during stockroom demolition.
MassDEP confirmed the asbestos was contained, and air and surface tests showed no asbestos present in the store.
